Class Monomial

  • java.lang.Object
    • Monomial

  • public class Monomial
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of Monomial is a wrapper class for an array containing the degrees associated with the monomial. The instance methods return simple information about the degrees that the class was initialized with but do not change the monomial. In addition, static methods for multiplication and division for monomials are introduced. While monomials are a natural case of polynomials, this class does not extend the class Polynomial. Instead, the asPolynomial() method converts the Monomial instance into a Polynomial containing a single term with unit coefficient.
    Author:
    Jefrey Judes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Monomial(int... degrees)
      An instance of a monomial in n variables is initialized with the integer degree (zero included) of all n variables listed in some consistent order.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int[] alpha()
      Returns an array of integers corresponding to the degrees of each variable.
      Polynomial asPolynomial()
      Converts the monomial into a polynomial containing the instance of Monomial with unit coefficient
      static Polynomial asPolynomial(Monomial m)
      Returns a polynomial containing a single term with the specified monomial and unit coefficient
      static Monomial divide(Monomial dividend, Monomial divisor)
      Returns the quotient monomial obtained by dividing the first monomial argument by the second.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Compares monomials by the array of degrees contained
      int getDeg(int i)
      Returns the degree of the variable at the specified position
      int hashCode()
      Creates a hashcode that is not unique to the instance, but rather to the array of degrees
      static java.lang.Boolean isDivisible(Monomial dividend, Monomial divisor)
      Specifies whether the first monomial argument is divisible by the second
      static Monomial multiply(Monomial m1, Monomial m2)
      Computes the product of two monomials in the same number of variables
      int n()
      Returns the number of variables that the monomial is in (including zero powers)
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string formatted as (x0)^deg(x0) (x1)^deg(x1) ...
      int totalDeg()
      Returns the sum of all degrees in the polynomial

    • Constructor Detail

      • Monomial

        public Monomial(int... degrees)
        An instance of a monomial in n variables is initialized with the integer degree (zero included) of all n variables listed in some consistent order. Note that this monomial can only be part of a term in a polynomial in n variables.

    • Method Detail

      • n

        public int n()
        Returns the number of variables that the monomial is in (including zero powers)

      • alpha

        public int[] alpha()
        Returns an array of integers corresponding to the degrees of each variable. This is exactly the array that the monomial was initialized with.

      • getDeg

        public int getDeg(int i)
        Returns the degree of the variable at the specified position
        Parameters:
        i - specifies the position, starting at 0 and ending at n

      • totalDeg

        public int totalDeg()
        Returns the sum of all degrees in the polynomial

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares monomials by the array of degrees contained
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Creates a hashcode that is not unique to the instance, but rather to the array of degrees
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string formatted as (x0)^deg(x0) (x1)^deg(x1) ...
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • asPolynomial

        public Polynomial asPolynomial()
        Converts the monomial into a polynomial containing the instance of Monomial with unit coefficient
        Returns:
        Polynomial in as many variables as the monomial contains

      • multiply

        public static Monomial multiply(Monomial m1,
                                Monomial m2)
        Computes the product of two monomials in the same number of variables

      • isDivisible

        public static java.lang.Boolean isDivisible(Monomial dividend,
                                            Monomial divisor)
        Specifies whether the first monomial argument is divisible by the second

      • divide

        public static Monomial divide(Monomial dividend,
                              Monomial divisor)
        Returns the quotient monomial obtained by dividing the first monomial argument by the second. This method can only be called when divisibility is guaranteed

      • asPolynomial

        public static Polynomial asPolynomial(Monomial m)
        Returns a polynomial containing a single term with the specified monomial and unit coefficient
        Parameters:
        m - specifies the Monomial to be placed in the polynomial
        Returns:
        Polynomial in as many variables as the monomial contains
